byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.

abstract: American airstrike mistakenly kills Iraqi troops, underscoring complexities of expanded collaboration between United States and Iraqi forces battling Islamic State; Defense Sec Ashton B Carter apologizes to Iraqi prime minister Haider al-Abadi, who has largely rebuffed American offers of support in deference to country's Shiite politicians.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter did not offer a detailed explanation for the errant airstrike, which the Iraqi government said killed at least nine Iraqi soldiers, but said, “It seemed to be a mistake that involved both sides.”

headline.main: U.S. Airstrike Killed Iraqis by Accident, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrike Killed Iraqis by Accident, Officials Say

snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter did not offer a detailed explanation for the errant airstrike, which the Iraqi government said killed at least nine Iraqi soldiers, but said, “It seemed to be a mistake that involved both sides.”
